Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping pays a two-day visit to Portugal that includes talks with President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa and Prime Minister Antonio Costa.

Headline: China confident on US trade deal on time
Description: China says it will push forward trade negotiations with the United States in the next 90 days while President Trump says he will place major tariffs if a deal cannot be reached.

Headline: US sanctions are 'economic terrorism,' Iran's Rouhani says
Description: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani said Afghanistan, China, Pakistan, Russia and Turkey, all were subject of "the economic terrorism which is designed to create panic in a country's economy in order to prevent investment."

Headline: China arrests former Canadian diplomat as feud escalates
Description: Michael Kovrig's detention comes after police in Canada arrested the chief financial officer of China's Huawei Technologies on December 1 at the request of US authorities.

Headline: 2nd Catholic bishop in China steps aside for state-approved cleric
Description: There are an estimated 10 million Catholics in China, divided between a government-run association whose clergy are approved by the Communist Party, and the unofficial church loyal to the Vatican.

Headline: Eight killed in China as hijacked bus crashes into pedestrians
Description: The bus was hijacked mid-afternoon and hit pedestrians along the way as it careened down the street in the city of Longyan, said police.

Headline: Activists detained as trial of China rights lawyer begins
Description: Wang Quanzhang, 42, who defended political activists and victims of land seizures, disappeared in a 2015 sweep known as the "709" crackdown aimed at courtroom critics of government critics.

Headline: China jails for life former top secret police official
Description: Ma Jian, once a vice minister at the Ministry of State Security, is one of the most senior security officials to be jailed since the former domestic security tsar Zhou Yongkang was ensnared in a graft scandal and jailed for life in 2015.

Headline: Trump says "big progress" on possible China trade deal
Description: Washington and Beijing imposed tit-for-tat tariffs on more than $300 billion worth of goods in total two-way trade this year.

Headline: Bill Gates' nuclear venture hits snag amid curbs on China deals
Description: TerraPower reached an agreement with state-owned China National Nuclear Corp in 2017 to build an experimental nuclear reactor in Beijing. But the plan fell though after new US restrictions on technology deals with China.

Headline: US lawmakers target China's ZTE with sanctions bill
Description: This is the second time lawmakers have introduced a bill on ZTE and sanctions. The previous bill, introduced in September, expired as the previous Congressional session ended.

Headline: New round of US-China trade talks to begin in DC
Description: Higher-level negotiations will take place on Thursday and Friday after efforts in Beijing last week came to a head without any deal or resolution to a fight over Beijing's technology ambitions ahead of a deadline for a massive US tariff hike.

Headline: Slowly but surely, China is moving into Afghanistan
Description: As the war in Afghanistan winds down, China looks to make Afghanistan a bigger part of its regional ambitions.

Headline: Taiwan says no compromise on democracy after opposition's China overture
Description: The island's Beijing-friendly KMT party said it could sign a peace deal with China if it wins a presidential election next year.

Headline: Saudi Arabia strikes $10B China deal, talks de-radicalisation with Xi
Description: Saudi Arabia signed 35 economic cooperation agreements with China worth a total of $28 billion at a joint investment forum during the visit, Saudi state news agency SPA said.

Headline: Plastic a thorn in South Korea's side as waste problem piles up
Description: Ever since China banned imports of almost all recycled waste, piles of trash have begun appearing around big cities in South Korea.

Headline: EU, Arab leaders vow to boost security, migration ties at first summit
Description: European countries see the summit is all the more important as the United States "disengages" from the region while Russia and China make inroads.

Headline: Trump to delay China tariff increase
Description: The United States is delaying a planned increase of tariffs on more than $200 billion in Chinese exports after "substantial progress" made in trade talks, US President Donald Trump said.

Headline: Protect rights of East Turkistan Uighurs – Turkey tells China
Description: Ankara supports "One China policy," but distinction should be made between "terrorists and innocent people," Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu tells Beijing in speech at UN Human Rights Council, Geneva.

Headline: Trump says could extend March 1 China trade talks deadline
Description: US president's comments come as the third round of trade negotiations between the US and China are set to resume in Beijing to avert more than doubling tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese imports.

Headline: The politics behind Pompeo's visit to Central Europe
Description: Experts say US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo’s statements against Russia and China in the Visegrad nations have more to do with protecting American business interests in a region that has been increasingly looking elsewhere.

Headline: Typhoon lashes south China after killing dozens in Philippines
Description: Typhoon Mangkhut hit the Philippines with gale force winds of 200 kph, unleashing widespread devastation in which at least 69 people have been killed so far.

Headline: China coal mine accident kills two and leaves 20 trapped
Description: More than 300 people were working inside the mine when the incident took place in Shandong province. Most have been successfully lifted to safety, while 20 remain trapped underground.

Headline: China’s Xi launches Hong Kong-mainland mega bridge
Description: The 55-kilometre (34-mile) crossing, which includes a snaking road bridge and underwater tunnel, links Hong Kong’s Lantau island to Zhuhai and the gambling enclave of Macau, across the waters of the Pearl River Estuary.

Headline: Japan PM heads to China looking for economic common ground
Description: The visit is the first by a Japanese premier since 2011 and is part of a years-long process of repairing ties in the wake of a disastrous falling-out in 2012, when Tokyo “nationalised” disputed islands claimed by Beijing.

Headline: China knife attacker wounds 14 kindergarten children
Description: Police say a knife-wielding woman attacked and wounded over a dozen children at the gate of a kindergarten in China's southwestern city of Chongqing, without giving possible motives for the attack.

Headline: UN chief taps Norwegian diplomat as new Syria envoy
Description: Geir Pedersen, Norway's ambassador to China, replaces Staffan de Mistura who is stepping down as UN envoy to Syria.

Headline: Passenger's fight with driver leads to bus crash killing 15 in China
Description: Police say a brawl between a passenger and a driver caused a bus to veer off a bridge in southwestern China.

Headline: Taliban officials say they will attend Moscow peace talks
Description: Representatives from Iran, China, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan are expected to attend the talks in Russia, but the United States and the US-backed Afghan government declined their invitations.

Headline: China's annual shopping frenzy shatters records again
Description: The spending binge has for years eclipsed Cyber Monday in the US for online purchases made on a single day. China's day is on November 11, or 'Singles' Day' since it's 11/11.

Headline: Solih sworn in as Maldives president, replaces pro-China leader
Description: Ibrahim Mohamed Solih, 54, emerged as common opposition candidate as all key dissidents were either jailed or forced into exile by Abdulla Yameen who took power following a controversial run-off in 2013.

Headline: APEC summit ends with no statement amid China-US differences
Description: The two-day summit in Papua New Guinea was punctuated by acrimony and underlined a rising rivalry between China and the West for influence in the usually neglected South Pacific.

Headline: Tension between the US and China increases
Description: For the first time in 25 years, the member countries of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) failed to make a joint statement on Sunday under the shadow of US and China trade war.

Headline: Blast kills 22 near north China chemical plant - official
Description: A blast near a chemical plant in China's northern Hebei province early on Wednesday killed 22 people and injured at least 22 others, the local government said.

Headline: Two Koreas start landmark journey for railway reconnection
Description: The railroad could provide valuable link to the rest of the world by making it faster to ship exports to China and Europe.

Headline: How China and India assert military dominance through Nepal
Description: Nepal is a staging ground for China and India's military dominance of South Asia. So what role can Nepal play as it is stuck between a rock and a hard place?

Headline: Huawei units plead not guilty to US trade secret theft
Description: The units of China’s Huawei Technologies Co Ltd were arraigned in US District Court in Seattle, and Chief US District Judge Ricardo S. Martinez set trial for March 2, 2020.

Headline: China sets robust growth target to shore up cooling economy
Description: The two-week gathering of the congress's 3,000-plus delegates in the Great Hall of the People is a grand political spectacle. But it does little law making, serving as a platform to highlight the government's plans for the year and earn endorsement.

Headline: Trump’s sanctions force China to slash taxes
Description: Beijing has turned to tax cuts to counter both the slowing economy and the US tariffs.

Headline: UN human rights chief paints bleak picture in annual report
Description: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, has demanded access from China to verify reports about abuses against Uighur Muslims. She also demanded the release of Saudi women activists.

Headline: Is the EU corridor an alternative to China's Belt and Road Inititiative?
Description: Will the European Union and China clash over China's plans in Eurasia?

Headline: Venezuela, Kim-Trump, Huawei - Chinese FM presser at NPC
Description: The crisis in Venezuela, the Kim-Trump summit in Hanoi and China's tech giant Huawei were key topics at a press conference by Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Friday on the sidelines of the country's ongoing National People's Congress.

Headline: Czech 'Donald Trump' meets real Donald Trump
Description: Why does Czech Republic's Prime Minister Andrej Babis, also known as Czech Donald Trump, lean towards the US, while the country's President Milos Zeman pursues strong ties with China?

Headline: China suspends use of Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft after deadly crash
Description: The Ethiopian Airlines 737 MAX 8 bound for Nairobi crashed minutes after take-off on Sunday, leaving 157 people dead.

Headline: UN probing North Korea sanction violations in 20 countries
Description: UN experts are investigating North Korea's alleged activities range from nuclear procurement in China to arms brokering in Syria.

Headline: US envoy calls China's Muslim concentration camps 'horrific,' wants probe
Description: China's officially atheist Communist government at first denied the existence of the internment camps in Xinjiang, but now says they are vocational training facilities aimed at countering Muslim radicalism and separatist tendencies.

Headline: Death toll in China chemical plant explosion rises to 44
Description: Thursday's blast at the Tianjiayi Chemical plant in the city of Yancheng is one of China's worst industrial accidents in years.

Headline: Italy endorses China's Belt and Road plan in first for a G7 nation
Description: Italy signs up for massive project which has sparked unease in US and EU as China aspires to greater world role.
